oracle.kv.table

Interface FieldDef

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ArrayDef, BinaryDef, BooleanDef, DoubleDef, EnumDef, FixedBinaryDef, FloatDef, IntegerDef, LongDef, MapDef, RecordDef, StringDef

    public interface FieldDef
    FieldDef represents an immutable metadata object used to represent a single data type. Data types are either simple, represented by a single value, or complex types which can have more than one value and may also be nested.

    FieldDef objects never stand alone. They are always defined as part of a RecordDef or other complex type. Some FieldDef types allow specification of properties and constraints, such as range constraints on numbers or strings. Additional properties may be assigned to a FieldDef instance in the context of its containing type, such as a default value for a field in a RecordDef.

    All supported data types are represented as instances of FieldDef. Supported types are defined in the enumeration Type. Instances are created when defining the fields for a new Table.

    Each instance has these properties:

    • type -- the type of the field
    • description -- an optional description used when defining the field
    FieldDefs are used to define the fields for other complex datatypes such as Table, RecordDef, etc.

    Since:
    3.0

        BinaryValue createBinary(byte[] value)

        Throws:

      • isValidKeyField

        boolean isValidKeyField()
        Returns:
        true if this type can participate in a primary key. Only simple, single-valued fields can be part of a key. Boolean is not allowed in keys.

      • isValidIndexField

        boolean isValidIndexField()
        Returns:
        true if this type can participate in an index. Only simple, single-valued fields and arrays of simple fields can be part of a key. Boolean is not allowed in indexes.
